channel.title: University Connection on Office of Water Programs
channel.description: Recent content in University Connection on Office of Water Programs

item.title: Teaching
item.description: OWP research engineers and scientists teach courses, lecture, and provide lab instruction in Sac State’s College of Engineering and Computer Science.

item.title: Student Assistants
item.description: OWP has a long history of helping to train tomorrow’s future engineers and leaders. Students who worked at OWP have gone on to work at the US Army Corps of Engineers, Brown and Caldwell, CH2M Hill, and with other industry leaders.

item.title: Regional Sanâ€”SASD Graduate Fellowship Opportunities 2019
OWP Fellowship Opportunities
item.description: Program Summary The Office of Water Programs (OWP) is pleased to offer a Graduate Research Fellowship for students currently pursuing master’s degrees at California State University, Sacramento. This Fellowship provides an opportunity for one or two students to fulfill their master’s project/thesis requirement by completing a research-based project in collaboration with OWP. Fellows will have the opportunity to work alongside faculty and research staff, and will be reimbursed for part-time tuition (up to 6 units) plus a one-time continuation fee (if needed) upon successful completion of the project.
